channel.title: Help on getting somone to connect to my server
channel.description: Okay so i change the gui file to my ip adress and my firewall was off so what do i do lol? when i clicked firewall setting it came up general ( turn it on or off ) Exceptions ( says programs ) (Add Program) (Edit) (Add Port) each of the things that are listed are checked then it says advanced and it says network conection settings wat do i click? and wat do

item.title: Help on getting somone to connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @markdabest33 markdabest33
item.description:
@markdabest33 wrote:

[quote=“x1 att ftw x, post:1, topic:375393”]Okay so i change the gui file to my ip adress and my firewall was off
so what do i do lol? when i clicked firewall setting it came up general ( turn it on or off )
Exceptions ( says programs )
(Add Program) (Edit) (Add Port) each of the things that are listed are checked then it says advanced and it says network conection settings wat do i click? and wat do[/quote] what ver is it 317 525 … ok go to cmd and type in ipconfig look for Defult Gateway mine is 192.168…
then open up ur internet n type it in it will ask for username and password type in

  1. un:admin
    Pw: (nothing)

  2. Un: Admin
    Ps: password

  3. Un: (notihing)
    Ps: (nothing)

then when u log in click on firewall setting (says for me) and port foword

the name what ever
port what port u want
end port same number
and type in ur defult gateway
:eek: :eek: :eek: :eek: :eek: ;D ;D ;D ;D

done!

Read full topic

item.title: Help on getting somone to connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

x1 att ftw x:

its been portforwarded

Portforwarding has to be done in your router, not your firewall. The exception only needs to be added in the firewall so that your computer will allow the connections. To actually receive them, you must forward the port (aka portforward) on your router to your computer.

Read full topic
